name: Gluten-Free Crackers
author: sueb
summary: These gluten-free crackers are made with garbanzo bean flour, sorghum flour, and rice bran. I needed to develop a cracker with ingredients I had on hand, and these worked!
ingredients: ⅓ cup garbanzo bean flour, or more as needed
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper

Mix garbanzo bean flour, sorghum flour, rice bran, water, Italian seasoning, vegetable oil, baking powder, honey, and salt together in a bowl until smooth dough forms, adding more garbanzo bean flour as needed to roll
Place dough on work surface between 2 sheets of parchment paper
Roll dough out to 1/8-inch thickness using a rolling pin
Remove top layer of parchment paper; cut dough using a 2-inch biscuit cutter and place 2 inches apart on prepared baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 10 minutes
